item.title: Website stuff
item.content:encoded:
Spent a little time re-arranging my website. Nothing fancy, just a few tweaks. I kind of like it plain text... need to find the time to style it slightly though. The typeface is hurting my eyes a little.

Also updated my twitter username! 'pbdiode'. Figured I'd stick with it since that's what I'm registered at ld48 with. It's time for a change I think.

item.title: We Have Sound
item.content:encoded:
10 Days left until the event!

I will be recording the event -- I'll be using 'recordmydesktop', with the following command:

recordmydesktop --no-sound --on-the-fly-encoding --v_quality 30 --no-frame

Then I just let it sit! Hopefully I'll have enough disk space... it is set to record at a crappy quality, so I should have enough space. And my tests indicate the text is at least readable... eh. We'll see.

Now on to finding out about audio...

WolframTones seems interesting, but I can't seem to get firefox configured correctly for it. I'm also having issues setting up PulseAudio, so I may have issues recording even a tone matrix output. Ugh.

I think I'm just going to forego the music for now. Less to stress me out, less to actually work on during the competition. I will, at least, have good sound effects from sfxr!

So, what do I need to do next to prepare?

  • I know what tech I'm using -- Javascript/HTML/CSS, melonJS
  • I'm axing the music generation
  • I have my tools ready -- a terminal, tmux, vim, chromium and firefox, sfxr, gimp, recordmydesktop, tiled
  • I've posted an 'I'm In' message on the ludum dare website (http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/06/im-in-255/) -- I posted under 'pbdiode', supposedly pronounced 'lead diode'. I think it sounded better in my head.

I think it's time I practice a bit. I think I'll do some exercises to get myself more familiar with melonJS.

item.title: Ludum Dare
item.content:encoded:
I just found out that the Ludum Dare #22 is in 11 days! I'm totally in.

To start preparing I've started playing with some music generation stuff, since, out of all my weaknesses, music and sound effects are by far my most weakest point::

  • sfxr
  • Audacity
  • Tone Matrix
  • inudge -- another tone matrix

I still need to figure out how to do some stuff with pulse audio so that I can record sounds generated by applications, then I can use the tone matrix apps to generate the music, and audacity to capture it.

I'll definitely be writing more about this!

item.title: Eat All The Things! p1

I've decided that I've learned enough from "Blocks of Destruction 2", and will be moving on to my next project. It will be a 'Pac-Man' like game.

item.title: BD2 p4
item.content:encoded:
What I've Done

  • Wow, really spent a lot of time studying collision detection (I discovered my previous utilities just weren't going to cut it). Found out that I'm a bit rusty on some math concepts, so I did a little review as well.
  • Finished implementing the Separating Axis Theorem for Circle to AABB shapes (and also AABB to AABB) -- N Tutorial A by Metanet Software Inc was probably THE most helpful resource on this subject.
  • Also decided to implement the library and a small test program in python + pygame. Why? I have less experience with Lua, and I'm finding that I can work faster in Python because of it (duh) -- basically I've just decided to use tools I know rather than experiment. I LOVE love2d, but I don't think a sweet api is enough for me, right now. Tech switches are dangerous when just trying to get something done, but I feel like I prototyped in love2d/lua, and now I'm actually building the game.
